ISSUE.TITLE: Scripts & processes error handling
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: **Describe the bug** The command line script contains [System.exit(1)](https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-api/src/main/java/org/dspace/scripts/handler/impl/CommandLineDSpaceRunnableHandler.java#L61), this ensures the script stops immediately The REST script in the [same method](https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-server-webapp/src/main/java/org/dspace/app/rest/scripts/handler/impl/RestDSpaceRunnableHandler.java#L136) doesn't stop the script This implies the `handleException` method works differently when used as a REST script, and the script will simply continue **Expected behavior** The [RestDSpaceRunnableHandler.handleException](https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-server-webapp/src/main/java/org/dspace/app/rest/scripts/handler/impl/RestDSpaceRunnableHandler.java#L136) should at least throw an exception so it stops from being executed
